metadata.title: CVE-2016-2056 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
xymond in Xymon 4.1.x, 4.2.x, and 4.3.x before 4.3.25 allow remoteauthenticated users to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharactersin the adduser_name argument in (1) web/useradm.c or (2) web/chpasswd.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xymon - 4.3.25-1
xymon-client - 4.3.25-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xymon package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.25-1').
